Package PayrollGUI

Class Date

java.lang.Object
PayrollGUI.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
Date class used to parse and store important dates.
Author:
Peter Basily, Quan Hoang

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date d)
      Compares two dates.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      d - Date to be compared.
      Returns:
      -1 If d is a later date, 0 if they are equal dates, and 1 if this date is a later date.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Overridden equals method, checks if the given object is an instance of Date then checks if the year, month, and day are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      obj - Object to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if the object given is an equal date to the instance. False otherwise.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the date.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the date in MM/DD/YYYY format.

    • isValid

      public java.lang.Boolean isValid()
      Checks to see if the date is valid.
      Returns:
      true if the date is a valid date (after the year 1900, before today's date, and matches criteria for a leap year) or false if it is not.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      testbed main for testing the Date class.
